title: RC circuits - 2 Rs and 1 C - initial current in R2

content.prompt: In the circuit shown, the switch is initially open and the capacitor is initially uncharged. Then the switch is closed. Which of the following correctly describes the current in Resistor R2 immediately after the switch is closed, and provides reasoning that supports the claim?

choices.label: It is zero. Resistor R2 is in parallel with the capacitor, which has no charge initially.
It is zero. A resistor in parallel with a capacitor behaves as an open circuit initially.
It is nonzero. Closing the switch establishes a potential difference across Resistor R2.
It is nonzero. Initially, none of the current in the circuit goes through the capacitor branch.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
